alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:51AM MDT until April 22 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River near Redfield affecting Spink County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Redfield. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Moderate flooding of significant amounts of agricultural and wooded areas begins At 23.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge 2 miles east of the gauge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:46 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 21.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:46 AM CDT Thursday was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Friday evening by 700 PM CDT.
